text:
Example: Capital asset pricing model
The expected return on the market is 15%, the risk-free rate is 8%, and the beta for
Stock A is 1.2. Compute the rate of return that would be expected (required) on this
stock.
Answer:
E(RA) = 0.08 + 1.2 (0.15 - 0.08) = 0.164
Note: BA > 1, so E(RA) > E(Rmky
